title: Castrovalva
dialogue_triumphs: The Doctor finds a medicine bottle labelled 'the solution'. 'Oh my little friend, if only you were!'
The Doctor asks a group of women the quickest way out of town. They all point in different directions. 'That's democracy for you.'
The Doctor asks Shardovan if he sees the 'spatial anomaly' of Castrovalva. 'With my eyes, no, but in my philosophy…'
'You made us, man of evil, but we are free!'
dialogue_disasters: Nyssa: 'I know so little about telebiogenesis.'
goofs: The Doctor's boots become shoes during regeneration.
The TARDIS is parked in a different field from that seen in 'Logopolis'.
Nyssa and Tegan's handbags appear on the console, not having been there in 'Logopolis'.
When the Doctor levitates in the zero room his coat tails levitate too, and his collar question marks are reversed.
The camera wobbles when Mergrave and Ruther go to see what caused the noise.
In the very last scene a fence is visible on the deserted planet.

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: The newly regenerated Fifth Doctor, struggling with post-regeneration difficulties.
continuity_notes.current_status: Recovering from regeneration, wearing glasses to read, and pinning celery to his lapel.

continuity_notes.name: Zero Room
continuity_notes.description: An isolated place in the TARDIS used by Time Lords after difficult regenerations.
continuity_notes.current_status: Partially jettisoned to escape Event One, with doors used to create a zero cabinet.

continuity_notes.name: Cloister Bell
continuity_notes.description: A warning device in the TARDIS that sounds during extreme danger.
continuity_notes.current_status: Heard as the TARDIS heads towards the beginning of the universe.

continuity_notes.name: The Master
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's nemesis, responsible for creating the illusion of Castrovalva.
continuity_notes.current_status: Manipulating events and creating elaborate traps for the Doctor.

roots: The work of Dutch artist M. C. Escher (set design, concepts of recursion and the title)
Jorge Luis Borges, especially 'Tlon, Uqbar, Orbis Tertius'
links: References to 'Full Circle', 'Warriors' Gate', 'Logopolis', and 'The Keeper of Traken'
Mentions of previous Doctors' mannerisms and companions

locations.name: The Pharos Project
locations.description: A radio telescope facility in Sussex, England.

locations.name: Castrovalva
locations.description: A fictional planet in the Andromeda galaxy, part of the Phylox series.
locations.current_status: Revealed to be an elaborate trap created by the Master

untold_adventures: Possible adventure with the Third Doctor, Ice Warriors, and the Brigadier
qv: See 'Four to Doomsday' for more on the TARDIS room full of cricketing memorabilia
additional_notes: The episode features a 'Fashion Victims' note about the Castrovalvan silly hats competition and Adric's clothing in the web.
bottom_line: There are many moments of magic in 'Castrovalva' (a child teaching the Doctor that three follows two, Shardovan sacrificing himself). It's everything you could possibly want from a post-regeneration story, re-establishing the series with a splash of 'hard' science fiction and much poetry.
